gate1_sections.name: Obligation Isolation Check
gate1_sections.reason: If this cannot be stated -> system design is invalid. Fix before proceeding.

gate1_sections.name: Indicator Corroboration
gate1_sections.reason: If indicators fail corroboration -> escalation prohibited.

gate1_sections.name: Typology Maturity Assessment
gate1_sections.reason: Escalation from FORMING typology is illegal.

gate1_sections.name: Suspicion Definition Test
gate1_sections.reason: If NONE apply -> escalation is forbidden.

gate2_sections.name: Legal Suspicion Threshold
gate2_sections.reason: If none apply -> NO STR (stop here)

rules_fired.citation_ref: FINTRAC Guideline 4 — Risk Assessment, OSFI B-10 s. 7
rules_fired.citation_text: Confirmed adverse media linking a client to money laundering, terrorist financing, fraud, corruption, or organized crime is a key risk factor requiring enhanced due diligence measures and potential STR filing.

Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act — Where a reporting entity has reasonable grounds to suspect that a transaction or attempted transaction is related to the commission or attempted commission of a money laundering offence or a terrorist activity financing offence, the entity shall report the transaction or attempted transaction to the Centre.

A reporting entity shall take reasonable measures to determine whether a person is a politically exposed foreign person, a politically exposed domestic person, or a head of an international organization. PEP status alone does not constitute reasonable grounds to suspect — additional risk factors must be present.

A suspicious transaction report shall be submitted when there are reasonable grounds to suspect that the transaction is related to the commission of a money laundering offence or a terrorist activity financing offence. Suspicion must be fact-based and articulable.

risk_factors.value: Adverse Media Mltf (Established — sufficient corroboration, pattern validated) [primary/CONFIRMED]

justifying_signals.detail: Adverse media: confirmed, linked to ML/TF

override_justification.justification: Gate 2 returned INSUFFICIENT due to evidence quality concerns. However, the Suspicion Classifier identified 1 Tier 1 suspicion indicator(s) that independently meet the Reasonable Grounds to Suspect (RGS) threshold under PCMLTFA/FINTRAC guidance. Under the classifier sovereignty framework, any single Tier 1 indicator is sufficient for STR determination regardless of gate evidence scoring.
override_justification.regulatory_basis: PCMLTFA s. 7 — Reasonable Grounds to Suspect (RGS) threshold

defensibility_check.note: Current reporting determination is consistent with precedent filing patterns.

enhanced_precedent.pattern_summary: Of 32 comparable cases, 64% (11 of 17 terminal) resulted in STR REQUIRED. 15 case(s) resolved through enhanced review processes (EDD/review states) rather than immediate determination.
alignment_context: 50 of 86 precedents (58%) were decided under superseded policy (PEP Risk Appetite Tightened). Alignment reflects policy divergence, not decisional error. Under current policy, 0% align.
